p: Overall, temperature (r = -0.42, p = 0.001) and precipitation (r = -0.3, p = 0.02) was found to be significantly correlated with test positivity whereas temperature (-0.3, p = 0.002) alone was correlated with the number of cases of influenza, similar findings were also seen in Islamabad. However, no significant correlation was found between meteorological parameters and influenza cases in Multan. ( Table 2).
